title: Modeling the Complexity of City Logistics Systems for Sustainability. (arXiv:2304.13987v1 [math.OC])
abstract: The logistics of urban areas are becoming more sophisticated due to the fast city population growth. The stakeholders are faced with the challenges of the dynamic complexity of city logistics(CL) systems characterized by the uncertainty effect together with the freight vehicle emissions causing pollution. In this conceptual paper, we present a research methodology for the environmental sustainability of CL systems that can be attained by effective stakeholders' collaboration under non-chaotic situations and the presumption of the human levity tendency. We propose the mathematical axioms of the uncertainty effect while putting forward the notion of condition effectors, and how to assign hypothetical values to them. Finally, we employ a spider network and causal loop diagram to investigate the system's elements and their behavior over time.

translated_title: 建模城市物流系统复杂度以促进可持续性
translated_abstract: 城市物流的发展日益复杂，尤其是城市人口的快速增长，使得利益相关者面临动态复杂的城市物流系统挑战，这些系统特点包括不确定性效应和货车排放污染。本文提出了一种研究城市物流系统环境可持续性的方法论，可通过在非混沌状态下有效利益相关者合作以及假设人的轻率倾向来实现。我们提出了不确定性效应的数学公理，并提出了条件影响因子及其如何分配假设值的概念。最后，我们采用蜘蛛网和因果回路图来研究系统元素及其随时间变化的行为。
tldr: 本文针对城市物流系统的动态复杂性和排放污染问题，提出了一种促进城市物流环境可持续性的方法论，通过有效利益相关者合作和假设人的轻率倾向来实现，同时引入不确定性效应的数学公理，并采用蜘蛛网和因果回路图来分析系统行为。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a research methodology to promote the environmental sustainability of city logistics systems, addressing the challenges posed by their dynamic complexity and pollution caused by freight vehicle emissions. The approach involves effective collaboration among stakeholders and assuming the human tendency towards levity in non-chaotic scenarios. The paper introduces mathematical axioms to account for uncertainty effects, as well as the concept of condition effectors and assigned hypothetical values. Finally, a spider network and causal loop diagram are employed to investigate system elements and changes over time.
